question: Kanjli wetland is located in which of the following states?
explanation: Kanjli wetland is located in Kapurthala district of Punjab. It was constructed to provide irrigation to the hinterland in the district and once home to several species of migratory birds. In 2002, the Ramsar Convention, an international body for the conservation and utilisation of wetlands, recognised this manmade wetland which is also a popular picnic spot. Black-crowned night heron, common moorhen, pond heron, purple swanphen, spotted owlet and white-breasted kingfisher are the commonly found birds at the wetland.
